page.title: 13Seasonal work on the farm
page.content: The farm work varies considerably from season to season. In the Autumn the main jobs include ploughing, hedge- cutting and sowing. Young cattle are taken to be sold at one of the local markets. At the start of Winter, usually in November, silage is cut. The main Winter work is farm maintenance, particularly of outbuildings, ditches and machinery. Spring tasks include maintenance of outbuildings, ditches and machinery. In the summer the farm is very busy. In addition to the normal feeding and looking after stock which takes place all year, important jobs are silage making, hay making and corn harvesting.
